Dear Mr. Derscheid:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,

ALLEGATION:
On 6/20/22, youth attempted to AWOL and staff member restrained youth. This did
not require a restraint.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30, 2022. Youth A
reported he could not sleep and crawled out of his bedroom window. Youth A stated
he walked toward the office building on campus and Staff 1 told him he needed to go
to the pavilion. Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed his arm, Youth A pulled his arm
away from Staff 1 and Staff 1 placed him in a restraint. Youth A denied trying to
punch or hit Staff 1. Youth A reported the restraint only lasted a “few minutes” then
he walked to the pavilion with Staff 1.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30, 2022. Staff 1
stated he was in the administrative building when he was asked to assist looking for
Youth A. Staff 1 reported he located Youth A on the hill of the facility’s property.
Staff 1 stated Youth A tried to run into the dark so Staff 1 placed Youth A into an
upper torso restraint. Staff 1 denied Youth A being aggressive. Staff 1 reported
being concerned for Youth A’s safety because it was dark and did not know where
Youth A was going.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30, 2022. Staff 2
stated Youth A was on the facility’s property walking toward the office when he was
2

located. Staff 2 reported Youth A wanted to go to a different facility on the property
so Staff 1 placed Youth A in an upper torso restraint. Staff 2 denied Youth A being
aggressive toward Staff 1 or Staff 2. Staff 2 stated the restraint took place in the
grass on the facility grounds.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on June 30, 2022.
Administrator reported he debriefed with Youth A, Staff 1 and Staff 2 after the
restraint. Administrator stated Youth A did not have any complaints about why or
how the restraint was performed. Administrator reported Youth A has a history of
breaking into things and staff did not have the confidence they could keep up with
Youth A if he left the property. Administrator stated the restraint occurred in the yard
by the shed on the facility’s property.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Michigan Department of Health and Human Services Incident Report
137890195 was consistent with staff and youth interviews.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 1
completed the required Safe Crisis Management training August 16 -20,
2021.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Rule 160. The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving
response for a youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others
from an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that
places the youth or others at serious threat of violence or
injury if no immediate intervention occurs.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Youth A was
restrained for being outside of the facility at 10:50pm wandering
the facility grounds. Youth A was not being aggressive or
displaying self-harming behaviors.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
